repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: W. Duke, Sons & Co. records and advertising materials
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: W. Duke, Sons & Co. was a tobacco manufacturer founded by Washington Duke in 1881. His son, James B. Duke, later became president of the American Tobacco Company. Collection comprises a volume containing meeting minutes for shareholders and the Board of Directors, 1885-1891, along with a volume of company costs and expenses, 1909-1953. There are also advertising materials dated 1876-1904, including trading cards, albums, and other advertising collectibles from the W. Duke Sons & Co., Liggett & Myers, American Tobacco, and other tobacco companies.

dao.xlink:title: W. Duke, Sons & Co. Advertising Materials, 1880-1910

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], W. Duke, Sons & Co. Advertising Materials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The W. Duke, Sons & Co. Advertising Materials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift. Formerly named the W. Duke, Sons & Co. Records.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jane Metters, Mandy Lowell, and Elisabeth Narkin, completed January 2013
Encoded by Elisabeth Narkin, Meghan Lyon, January 2013
Updated by Kimberly Sims, August 2013 Updated by Alice Poffinberger, October 2015

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: W. Duke, Sons & Co. was a tobacco manufacturer founded by Washington Duke in 1881. His son, James B. Duke, later became president of the American Tobacco Company. For more information on Duke family history, please visit the University Archives.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The W. Duke, Sons & Co. records and advertising materials includes a volume containing meeting minutes for shareholders and the Board of Directors, 1885-1891, along with a volume of company costs and expenses, 1909-1953. There are also advertising materials dated 1876-1904, including a wide assortment of tobacco trading cards and other collectibles from the W. Duke, Sons & Co, Allen & Ginter, Kinney Bros. Co., Liggett & Myers, and many other tobacco brands. The collection has been arranged into Trading Cards, Booklets, Albums, and Assorted, depending on the format of the materials. The Trading Cards Series is by far the largest, and includes card collections of notable actresses, baseball players, public figures, and politicians, alongs with collections of country costumes, flags, wildlife, ships, musical instruments, and flowers. The Booklets series is a sort of subset of the trading cards, featuring small card-size booklets with stories and illustrations of famous people. The Albums Series includes bound scrapbooks, with individual collected cards, as well as albums published by the different tobacco companies that printed an entire series of cards. Finally, the Assorted Series includes stationary, oddly-shaped cards, background material, and cigarette boxes and tobacco pouches, some still full of cigarettes and tobacco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains trading cards of various sizes and themes such as "Girls," "Actresses," "Coins of all Nations," and "Baseball Champions." The majority of these cards were distributed by W. Duke, Sons & Co., however other companies, such as Liggett & Myers, Allen & Ginter, American Tobacco, and Turkish Red, among others, are also represented.

Henry walks to lineman on pole who looks just like his monkey on a stick.

Henry leaning back on man's stomach, gets pushed by fat gentleman with hat.
Henry holding basket, uses hot-dog links on a stick as carrot for dog tied to him with rope to pull him along.
Henry saws branch using a two person saw with friend who sits on wrong side.
Henry rides cart in revolving door being pushed by two men.
Henry lying on coaster tied to wagon, drinks from barrel marked "Treacle."
Henry sitting on stool, plays cash register like instrument in music shop.
Henry pushes cart horse away from trough in which he is taking a bath.

Henry steals child's place in horse cart being driven by a woman.
Henry uses musician's horn as funnel to pour water into auto's radiator.
Henry leaning out a window, holds umbrella over bass horn for man in rain.
Henry holds pinwheel in front of fat man in red coat, blue pants, playing sax.
Henry sits on block of ice fanning himself as man pulls with ice tongs.
Henry carries dog in birdcage with bird on head past "No Dogs Allowed" sign.
Henry slides banister behind friend who is about to hit end pole.
Henry take nuts from lady on bench reading a book and feeding squirrel.
Henry leaning across rail against bars, looks at monkey named "Henry."
Henry sits on chair holding yarn for girl while boys laugh outside window.

Henry on skates with pillow tied to rear, gets pushed by billygoat.
Henry sits on overstuffed green chair as man carries it from moving van.
Henry brings hobby horse with sawed off head to veterinary surgeon to fix.
Henry rides on back spare tire on auto with "Just Married" sing.
Henry sitting between couple on sofa, takes candy and money to go away.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains small booklets from cigarette packages. The booklets include an image on the cover and printed text inside.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series includes a variety of other advertising materials, such as stationary, albums, and a set of watercolor prints produced by R. H. Macy & Co. which were distributed by various cigarette companies including W. Duke, Sons, & Co., among others. The series also includes information on the exhibition of these advertising materials at Duke University and the Duke Homestead Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains albums produced by cigarette companies such as W. Duke, Sons & Co., Consols Cigarettes, and Allen & Ginter Co. These bound albums were produced for collectors of trading cards and reproduce the full series of cards such as "Costumes of All Nations" and "Yacht Colors of the World."
